prompt: <description>**Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape** **Part 1** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The Euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.482, 0.0]. This will position and orient the prism on the work plane. 2. **Draw the first face of the prism.** This face is a rectangle with the following line segments: * Line 1: Begin at [0.0, 0.0] and end at [0.241, 0.0] * Line 2: Begin at [0.241, 0.0] and end at [0.241, 0.3792] * Line 3: Begin at [0.241, 0.3792] and end at [0.241, 0.5841] * Line 4: Begin at [0.241, 0.5841] and end at [0.0, 0.5841] * Line 5: Begin at [0.0, 0.5841] and end at [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Draw the second face of the prism.** This face is also a rectangle, and it shares the line segment [0.241, 0.3792] - [0.241, 0.5841] with the first face. It consists of the following line segments: * Line 1: Begin at [0.241, 0.3792] and end at [0.75, 0.3792] * Line 2: Begin at [0.75, 0.3792] and end at [0.75, 0.5841] * Line 3: Begin at [0.75, 0.5841] and end at [0.241, 0.5841] * Line 4: Begin at [0.241, 0.5841] and end at [0.241, 0.3792] 4. **Scale the sketch.** Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the entire sketch to create a slightly tapered rectangular prism shape. 5. **Extrude the sketch.** The desired extrusion depth in the normal direction is 0.482, while in the opposite direction is 0.0. Apply the scaling factor 0.75 during the extrusion process. **Part 2** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** The Euler angles are [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] and the translation vector is [0.0723, 0.2892, 0.0]. This will position and orient the cylindrical cut feature on the work plane. 2. **Draw a circle to represent the cylindrical cut feature.** * Center: [0.0482, 0.0482] * Radius: 0.0482 3. **Extrude the circle along the cylinder's axis.** The desired extrusion depth in the normal direction (opposite of the cylinder's axis) is 0.0, while in the opposite direction is 0.241. Apply the scaling factor 0.0964 during the extrusion process. Use the "CutFeatureOperation" to remove the material and create a cylindrical hole in the prism.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 3 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1992, 0.2656, 0.1328] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. On the sketch, create a loop with the following curves: * line_1: Start at (0.0, 0.0) and end at (0.0166, 0.0) * line_2: Start at (0.0166, 0.0) and end at (0.3699, 0.0) * line_3: Start at (0.3699, 0.0) and end at (0.3865, 0.0) * line_4: Start at (0.3865, 0.0) and end at (0.3865, 0.6172) * line_5: Start at (0.3865, 0.6172) and end at (0.0, 0.5578) * line_6: Start at (0.0, 0.5578) and end at (0.0, 0.0) 4. Close the loop. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6172. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the existing coordinate system properties. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis with a depth of 0.2656. 8. Define the resulting 3D model as part 1. Part 2 Create a small rectangular prism flush and centered with the left side of the main prism. The cross-section should have a triangle shape with a 0.5:1 height-to-base ratio. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.5691, 0.2656, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. On the sketch, create a loop with the following curves: * line_1: Start at (0.0, 0.0) and end at (0.0166, 0.0) * line_2: Start at (0.0166, 0.0) and end at (0.0166, 0.1328) * line_3: Start at (0.0166, 0.1328) and end at (0.0, 0.1328) * line_4: Start at (0.0, 0.1328) and end at (0.0, 0.0) 4. Close the loop. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1328. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the existing coordinate system properties. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch along the z-axis with a depth of 0.0166. 8. Define the resulting 3D model as part 2. Part 3 Create a duplicate of part 2 and translate it to the right side of the main prism. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1992, 0.2656, 0.0] 2. Create a new part based on the existing part 2. 3. Translate the new part to the right side of the main prism. 4. Define the resulting 3D model as part 3. Part 4 Create a long circular rod centered in the middle of the main prism. 1. Create</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: A long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat base and a pointed top.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [ -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 ] - Translation Vector: [ 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 ] Create the sketch for the base of the part on the X-Y plane. The loop consists of 8 lines, and it forms the boundary of the sketch. No circles or arcs are present in this sketch. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.0536 units. After this operation, you'll obtain the final shape, which is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat base and a pointed top. The part dimensions have been provided in the JSON, and they are as follows: - Length: 0.0536 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.75 Use these dimensions for the CAD model to ensure accuracy.</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and parallel sides** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face\\_1) with one loop (loop\\_1) and four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4). - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop (loop\\_1) closes the shape by connecting line\\_4 to line\\_1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Apply a 3D transform to the scaled 2D sketch to position it in the desired location. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.025 units along the normal direction to create the 3D model. **Intermediate Part 2: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.025]. Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of two faces (face\\_1, face\\_2) with one loop (loop\\_1) on each face. Face\\_1 has four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) and face\\_2 has four lines (line\\_5, line\\_6, line\\_7, line\\_8). For face\\_1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.025] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.025], End Point [0.0, 0.025] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.025], End Point [0.0, 0.0] For face\\_2: - Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.1], End Point [0.75, 0.1] - Line 6: Start Point [0.75, 0.1], End Point [0.75, 0.125] - Line 7: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.125] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.125], End Point [0.0, 0.1] Each loop (loop\\_1) closes the shape by connecting the lines in the correct order. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Apply a 3D transform to the scaled 2D sketch to position it in the desired location. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.4167 units along the normal direction to create the 3D model and join it to the previous part. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The length, width, and height are approximately 0.75, 0.75, and 0.42 units, respectively.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0937, 0.0] For face 1, first create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system: - Draw a polyline with 3 straight segments (lines) with the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.6495] and [0.375, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.375, 0.0] and [0.75, 0.6495] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.6495] and [0.0, 0.6495] For face 2, create a separate 2D sketch on the XY plane of the same coordinate system: - Draw a triangle with 3 straight segments (lines) with the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.1613, 0.5558] and [0.3723, 0.1883] - Line 2: [0.3723, 0.1883] and [0.5844, 0.5558] - Line 3: [0.5844, 0.5558] and [0.1613, 0.5558] The triangular cutout is created by subtracting the volume of the triangular prism (face 2) from the rectangular prism (face 1). Use an "IntersectFeatureOperation" to intersect the two volumes and create the final shape. Scale the sketch by 0.75 and extrude it along the Z-axis to the given depth: - Extrusion depth towards normal (Z-axis): 0.0937 - Extrusion depth opposite normal (Z-axis): 0 The dimensions of the final shape are: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.0938 units - Height: 0.75 units (0.6495 sketch height + 0.0937 extrusion depth) This part has been constructed as described. Continue to the next part or operation.</description>
